class.name: G4MFMesh4D
class.brief_description: Represents visual geometry that may be attached to G4MF nodes.
class.description: G4MFMesh4D is a class for 4D meshes in the G4MF format. It is used to represent visual geometry found in a G4MF scene. It may be attached to G4MF nodes using a [G4MFMeshInstance4D] so that it may be rendered in the Godot scene at the given transform. A mesh is a collection of surfaces, each of which may have different materials. [b]Note:[/b]: Godot 4D currently only supports one surface per mesh, but multiple surfaces are allowed in the G4MF format.

method.name: can_generate_tetra_meshes_for_all_surfaces
method.description: Checks if all surfaces in the mesh can generate tetrahedral meshes, meaning that they all have a non-negative [member G4MFMeshSurface4D.cells_accessor_index]. This does not check if the accessor exists or if it contains valid data. Returns [code]true[/code] if all surfaces can generate tetrahedral meshes, and returns [code]false[/code] if even one surface cannot.

method.name: export_convert_mesh_into_state
method.description: Converts the given [Mesh4D] into a [G4MFMesh4D] inside of the [G4MFState4D], encoding all data of the mesh inside of the buffers and accessors of the [G4MFState4D]. This is used for exporting the mesh to G4MF, and is the inverse of [method import_generate_mesh]. The [G4MFMesh4D] will be added to the [G4MFState4D]'s meshes array, and the index of the new mesh will be returned, which may be used on nodes or anything else. If this function fails, it will return [code]-1[/code].

method.name: from_dictionary
method.description: Converts the given [Dictionary] representing the JSON of a G4MF mesh to a [G4MFMesh4D]. This will set the fields of the [G4MFMesh4D] and [G4MFItem4D] classes based on the data in the [Dictionary].

method.name: import_generate_mesh
method.description: Generates a [Mesh4D] from the [G4MFMesh4D] data inside of the [G4MFState4D]. This will create either a [ArrayTetraMesh4D] or [ArrayWireMesh4D] and return it. This is used for importing a mesh from G4MF, and is the inverse of [method export_convert_mesh_into_state]. If [member G4MFState4D.force_wireframe] is set to true, the mesh will always be generated as a wireframe mesh. Otherwise, the mesh will be generated as a tetrahedral mesh if the [G4MFMesh4D] defines cells, or as a wireframe mesh if the [G4MFMesh4D] does not define cells.

method.name: is_equal_exact
method.description: Checks if the [G4MFMesh4D] is equal to another [G4MFMesh4D] exactly by checking if the surface count is the same and all surfaces have the same exact data and refer to the same accessors. If a surface refers to a different accessor, even if the data is the same, this will return [code]false[/code]. The name of the mesh is not checked, and any metadata is ignored.

method.name: load_vertices
method.description: Loads the vertices from the [G4MFAccessor4D] at [member vertices_accessor_index] in the [G4MFState4D]'s accessors array. This is a low-level function that will fail if the index does not refer to a valid [G4MFAccessor4D] or if the accessor does not contain valid vertex data.

method.name: to_dictionary
method.description: Converts the G4MF mesh to a [Dictionary]. This is used for serializing the G4MF mesh as JSON.

members.member: An array of [G4MFMeshSurface4D]s that define the geometry of the mesh. Each surface may have a material.
The index of the [G4MFAccessor4D] in the [G4MFState4D]'s accessors array that contains the vertex data for this mesh. Each vertex is a 4D vector. Vertices are shared between all mesh surfaces.
